Fitness Advice

10 Diet Myths That Are Keeping You From Losing Weight

April 7, 2023 ‚Ä¢ By Transform Team

Have you been following all the latest diet advice but have yet to drop a pound?

We‚Äôve all been there: you think you‚Äôre following the best (or fastest) route to a slim physique, but it just doesn‚Äôt seem to be happening. You could be following diet advice that‚Äôs actually a total myth. You think you‚Äôre doing the right thing ‚Äì but are you?

Stay on track with your weight loss by reading these diet myths so you know what not to do from now on!

Top Diet Myths That Are Stopping You from Losing Weight

Here are the most common diet myths that could be stopping you from losing weight.

Working Out Means You Can Eat Whatever

Abs are made as much in the kitchen as they are in the gym. You can‚Äôt lose weight just by working out and then stuffing yourself with pizza.

While the theory of calories in versus calories out suggests this myth is true, in reality, the quality of your calories is just as important in helping you achieve your weight loss goals.

A Calorie Is a Calorie

Not all calories are equal, which is why calorie-counting your way to a size six isn‚Äôt always the best approach.

Calories don‚Äôt take into account the nutritional benefit of a food. Something that‚Äôs high in calories could be good or bad for you. Avocado, for example, is high in calories because of its natural fat content, but there are plenty of vitamins included too. A candy bar with the same calorie count, however, won‚Äôt provide you with balanced nutrition.

Protein Shakes Help You Lose Weight

Protein shakes are designed for athletes and those who have heavy workouts to help replenish essential nutrients the body uses up during exercise.

If you do have a protein shake after your intense exercise workouts, make sure you‚Äôre accounting for these calories in your daily intake. It‚Äôs easy to underestimate your liquid calories and protein shakes provide a calorie hit that you might not need.

Eggs Are Bad for You

This myth started decades ago when the cereal companies wanted to sell more breakfast cereal. They conducted a self-funded study to show that cereal was better for breakfast than eggs, which had been the standard morning fare.

An egg, however, is a wonder food. Filled with protein and vital nutrients, eggs will provide a filling snack or add essential amino acids to any meal. They are low in calories and pack a high-nutrient punch.

Don‚Äôt Eat After 8 pm

Food can‚Äôt tell time. Your body will always digest and use the energy you eat at any time ‚Äì if you eat late, it‚Äôll store the excess until you need it in the morning.

Eating just before bedtime has downsides, though. It‚Äôll leave you with a full stomach that will disturb your sleep as it digests, leaving you tired and tempted for a sugary snack when you wake up.

Pasta Should Be Avoided

When you‚Äôre following a diet and exercise regimen your body needs reliable carbohydrates for essential processes at a cellular level.

Pasta has been given a bad rep in recent times, not least since gluten intolerance became fashionable. However, eating moderate amounts of pasta the day before a big workout can make a big difference and help you achieve your personal best.

Portion size is the key with pasta: try having it as a side rather than a main meal, to avoid overloading on calories. Ditch the creamy sauces, too, and opt for a tomato-based sauce instead.

Fasting is Best for Quick Weight Loss

Fasting for days on end will make you lose water weight, and because you‚Äôre not eating food you‚Äôll also notice that you‚Äôre less bloated.

It is not, however, a long-term solution to lose weight. You only lose water weight (and after time, muscle mass) if you‚Äôre fasting ‚Äì not fat.

Intermittent fasting has shown some benefits in aiding weight loss in some individuals, but this is often because of the natural calorie restriction. It‚Äôs harder to eat a full day‚Äôs calories in one small time period, so people on an intermittent fasting regimen are likely to be eating less overall.

Fasted Workouts Make You Lose Weight Quickly

The idea behind a fasted workout is that your body will use the energy stores it already has. In theory, that means you‚Äôre using up fat already in your body rather than using energy from recently-eaten food.

However, eating after a fasted workout will restore your body‚Äôs energy levels to its previous state. Fasting will also reduce your stamina, so you won‚Äôt be able to exercise for as long or as hard.

You Can Eat As Much As You Like If It‚Äôs Healthy

Healthy foods still have calories so eating lots and lots will scupper your weight loss goals. You need to monitor how many calories you eat and drink during the day if you want to lose weight.

Healthier calories from vegetables are great ‚Äì but they still count towards your daily intake.

Exercise Makes You Gain Weight

You will only bulk up with exercise if that‚Äôs your goal. You will, however, notice the scale goes up and down when you‚Äôve made big changes to your workout schedule.

Exercise causes micro-tears in the muscles. This makes your body deploy its response to inflammation: swelling. After a very heavy workout, you could gain a few pounds of water weight. This will go away after a few weeks, though!

Three Surprising Diet Myths That Are Actually True

With those diet myths busted, what about the surprising tips you‚Äôve heard about but don‚Äôt think are true?

Zero Calorie Foods Exist

Yes, there are foods that contain fewer calories than it takes to digest them, making them zero- or negative-calorie foods. These include celery, cucumber, and grapefruit.

However, these foods are often limited in nutrients too, so go easy on them and remember that a ‚Äòrainbow diet‚Äô with lots of different colors on your plate is the way to go.

Sleep Helps You Lose Weight

It‚Äôs not just because you can‚Äôt eat while you sleep, either. Sleep regulates certain hormones in the body, such as ghrelin, which activates the ‚Äòhunger‚Äô feeling in the stomach.

Good sleep hygiene, including getting plenty of rest on a regular daily routine, is very important for anyone on a diet. It helps to restore your energy and lets your body recover and repair itself from your workouts.

Drink Water to Lose Weight

Water isn‚Äôt going to be the only thing that helps you to lose weight, but staying hydrated will move you towards your goals. Thirst is often mistaken for hunger, so instead of reaching for a snack when you feel a rumble in your stomach, have a drink of water first instead.

Drinking water also means you‚Äôre not taking in excess calories in the form of other drinks, such as cream-laden coffee or sugary iced tea.

Lose Weight the Right Way

Now those diet myths have been busted it‚Äôs time to discover how you can actually lose weight. Check out our ultimate guide to getting that summer body and start seeing results!
